page.title: 14East Street Scheme, Bristol
page.content: East Street shopping centre contains about 100 shops, banks, public houses and other businesses, but no large retail shop. However the roads are very busy and pedestrians frequently have to walk in the streets. A lot of people shop in East Street, especially the old people who cannot get to the hypermarkets on the outskirts of the city. People find car parking difficult. The top class in Holy Cross school invited Mr. Blackburn from the Planning Office to come and discuss the scheme. One thing the children were concerned with was the fact that rounders balls would hit the cars in the proposed car park next to the school's playing field. The children thought that having Asda (a hypermarket) built on the Imperial Factory Site has its good and bad points.
